content.title: CEAP Classification of Chronic Venous Disease
content.definition: An international standardized classification system for chronic venous disorders based on Clinical severity, Etiology, Anatomy, and Pathophysiology.

concepts.definition: Grading of visible and symptomatic manifestations of venous disease.

clinical_features.C0: No visible or palpable signs of venous disease

concepts.definition: Classification by cause of venous disease.
Location of venous disease within the venous system.

clinical_features.basic_reporting: C class with s/a suffix (e.g., C4b,s)
clinical_features.updated_version: CEAP 2020 revision with C2r, C4c, C6r additions

content.statement: CEAP Classification of Chronic Venous Disease is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Venous Classification that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding CEAP Classification of Chronic Venous Disease helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of CEAP Classification of Chronic Venous Disease include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of CEAP Classification of Chronic Venous Disease.
